Reviews.Title: “close to the main touristy area”
Reviews.Author: Rita F
Reviews.Content: the rooms were fine, not so big and not so luxury and little dark. but clean and close to everything. price could be a little bit less by 20% for that room. service was average not excellent but they were also very busy. no restaurant, but you can easily walk to any good restaurant in town. walking distance to most of the ocean view attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: FHsu
Reviews.Content: I booked this room based on some of the reviews in Trip Advisor. However, I was disappointed by the hotel. My first room smelled of smoke and mold. It was so bad I checked out right away so they upgraded me to a nicer room with double beds. This room was better, but it still had a moldy smell to it. I was traveling with another person, and her room also had a bad smell of mold and some mold in her room. The hotel is in need of some cleaning up. In addition, 2 trains came by at night: one at 2:00am and the next one at 2:30 am. It sounded like the train was only a couple of block away and I was woken up twice by these trains. Needless to say I did not get a great nights sleep and will not be coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Rob M
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! Stayed here for one night before an early morning flight. Room was clean, comfortable and well appointed. Little Italy is right behind the hotel, and with a bunch of good restaurants. Also, the marina is a block in front of the hotel. But the best thing about this hotel was the free shuttle service to the airport. We had a 6am flight, and sure enough, the shuttle was right there to pick us up at 430am for the ride to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay at all!”
Reviews.Author: StanDubar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2010, great location right by the harbor, close to the convention center, Maritime Museum, and the USS Midway. Great and cheap place to stay for all you lucky folks who got to go to Comic Con this year!

Reviews.Title: “For people who want everything at a low price”
Reviews.Author: Firefanne
Reviews.Content: I am surprised by all of the bad reviews. Yes this place is kinda old and worn, but I think it was still a good deal. The people at the front desk were all nice and helpful. Check in was 3 minutes and easy, check out was even faster and easier. The rooms are fine. I thought this way a really great deal. I wanted to be downtown, and I was looking at fancier more expensive hotels. I was debating about paying the extra money, until I realized that I would also have to pay for parking, wifi, and breakfast. At that point I made my decision. This is a good location close to the airport, Little Italy, downtown, the train, etc. We were nearby all of the attractions we wanted to see. (We walked to the train to go to the gaslamp district.) Yes this is a low end motel. But it has a good staff, pool, free breakfast (regular continental breakfast, but I eat cereal and fruit at home for breakfast so I'm fine eating it on vacation), free wifi, and free parking.

Reviews.Title: “A step up from your average motel”
Reviews.Author: RobWinmar
Reviews.Content: This place cost us a bit more than other places we stayed at, but the room was also noticeably better. It was very nicely done up, with a big flat screen tv and nice decor, plus a bath. The fridge, microwave and coffee maker were nice touches. Breakfast was provided, but it was nothing brilliant. The location isn't downtown, but is within walking distance, and it was a great spot for getting down to the water. We were also able to walk from there to Little Italy and the magnificent Balboa Park. The staff were very obliging, even letting me use their computer to print off a flight ticket. Plus the wireless connection actually worked in the room, which is certainly not something that applied to every place we stayed at. I'd definitely stay there again if I had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, near public transport;good price”
Reviews.Author: maestrolms
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its nearness to San Diego International Airport, but ALSO because it is within a one-block walk of San Diego's Trolley, part of the city's marvelous transport net. I had flown here for one night, specifically to hear an opera performed at the Civic Theater; I was pleased to walk one block, hop on the trolley ISenior fare of $1.25) and be deposited outside the theater in less than fifteen minutes. Likewise, after the final curtain at 9:50, I walked back out to the nearby trolley and was back in my room by 10:25! The building is NOT new, but has had some nice renovations, such as granite tops and showers! Beds and pillows are very comfortable; I had a nice 1 king room with plenty of space for a sofa and separate writing area. Desk staff was very helpful; free airport shuttle is less than 10 minutes from the terminal. Free continental breakfast, but NO waffles :(. I found this stay to be a very good value and will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Babby86
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money.Great location.Friendly staff.Advantage--FREE roundtrip transport from airport.Good for business travellers if staying alone.Breakfast OK.Rooms avarage.Needs renovation.Overall great value for money.Value deals if booked well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: EJWynn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. Our first night was ok, but with the train noise, we asked to move to a room that did not back onto the rail tracks. The new room looked fine but my husband woke up with bites/lumps on him after the second night. We haven't experienced bed bugs before so didn't know what they were. We thought it was hives (as he has itchy welts all over him) but after antihistamines proving to be ineffective he looked for other causes. It wasn't until our last night that we suspected bed bugs. We couldn't initially see anything in the bed / mattress, but when we looked the next morning we saw them!! We informed staff, Arthur was very apologetic but didn't know what to do/say except sorry. We were initially sent away without any offer for a refund / compensation. I went back (after other guests had left the reception area) to again express how angry we were, and that we potentially have to throw out all our possessions / luggage and / or pay for laundry for our entire bag's contents (we live in Australia) and won't be home for another 3 weeks.. Arthur by this time had called his manager to get approval to reimburse us our final nights stay. 5 nights for the price of 4 in a bed bug infested room.. Tital room cost $330 And consequently have to throw out our clothes / shoes / luggage and replace them: total loss of luggage / clothes $800-1000. I really don't think the reimbursement of $100 for our final night was sufficient do you? Stay away from this place or at least check that they have successfully managed their bed bug outbreak! I am sorry to have to write this but as a traveller I would expect the same feedback from others out there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: lillian733
Reviews.Content: Excelent ;location and service to the guest.adequate price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: Epage3
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Only spent one night here but my pillow smelt funny, I should've asked for a new one but it was late so this is partly my own fault. However everything else was adequate and price reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: weggerzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in early September 2011 and didn't request it but got a third floor room which was great due to the beamed ceilings and made the room seem very large, we had two queen beds. Our AC didn't work well so we reported it and within a short time, two cleaning ladies brought in a brand new unit, took out the old one and put in the new one and we were in business. They were very efficient and very sweet. We also reported twice that our bathtub drain plug didn't hold water and nothing was ever done about it. Our grandchildren enjoyed the pool (grandpa thought the water was a little cold) and noticed the area was swept at least once during our stay. The free breakfast was adequate for OJ, cereal, fruit, toast, sweet rolls, coffee and tea. Little Italy is a short walk and we walked to Seaport Village more than once, about a mile (we are walkers). This also means downtown is walkable but the trolley is one block away and buses are about the same for going to Ocean Beach, Seaworld, Pacific Beach, etc. We'll stay here again. (one glitch was we prepaid and when we got the final bill we had a two cent balance.........we didn't pay it since we had already paid in full).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at this Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: TravelgalMissouri
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed six nights at the Days Inn. They provided transportation from the airport and check in was easy. Our room was clean and comfortable. It is centrally located and a easy jumping off point for many area attractions. The pool is small, but nice. The breakfast was good for us.

Reviews.Title: “I Absolutely Despised This Place”
Reviews.Author: Taylor W
Reviews.Content: It sucks when you dread coming back to your hotel while traveling. I was only here to sleep and take showers while going around town. (This scenario is usually due to traveler's remorse rather than... returner's remorse) When we first showed up (with reservations) they denied us a room. The concierge was incredibly rude, but we did eventually work out a deal because they were going to take our money either way. The next day the maids told us "We have work to do, get out of your rooms so we can clean." This is verbatim. The Hot Tub was cold, the rooms were pretty ugly, and that whole thing about fast internet? HA. This morning I woke up to (unsurprisingly) them power washing my window. I let the people know that I was unhappy about being woken up, but they just smiled at me and kept cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: SouthGATraveler79
Reviews.Content: My sister and I shared a double queen room when we traveled to San Diego to attend the wedding of our brother and made it a vacation. Our priorities for lodging were safe, clean and affordable with walkability of the city. This hotel exceeded all of those expectations. My sister was somewhat concerned about the outdoor rooms, but this concern was quickly allevitated upon check-in (particularly with the signage that this is not a party hotel and all violaters with receive a call to the police). We were upgraded to one of the three balcony view rooms at no extra charge (thanks Wyndham Rewards!). The hotel desk staff were extremely courteous and helpful during our entire stay (Thurs-Tues) offering directions, providing detailed maps and highlighting routes. They also delivered washcloths to our room at six a.m. and insisted we call them at anytime with any disturbances. The hotel is walkable to the harbor, Little Italy and a brief drive (or trek) to the GasLamp. We did not rent a car until the fourth day of our stay and were able to do a lot of fun things (eating on the harbor and in LIttle Italy and visiting the Farmer's Market in Little Italy) . The breakfast is what one would expect. . .bagels, toast and dry cereal. Coming from the East Coast (three hr. time difference) this was sufficient to hold us over until restaurants opened. The room included a microwave, mini refrigerator/freezer and coffee maker. The coffee was replenished daily. If you want to use public transportation, a trolley stop is couple of block down and two bus stops are just across pacific coast highway. We only heard trains/planes when the sliding glass door was open. I am a light sleeper and I slept great! I would most definitely stay again at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Several annoyances; otherwise a typical Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: Argyle
Reviews.Content: I don't like to nitpick, but I couldn't access their wifi for the 3 days I was there (unless I went into the lobby, and they gave me the cord to connect directly to their router, which was a pain in the neck; they said the next room over had access; all I know is that I stayed in 4 hotels on this trip and I had excellent Internet access in all but this hotel), and there was a drip from the bathroom ceiling that didn't get fixed even after the front desk told me that maintenance would take care of it. Other than that, it's a typical Days Inn. Probably the best thing is that it's really easy walking distance to San Diego's Little Italy. It's literally a 5 minute walk. Plus, it's very convenient to the airport, and easy access to Route 5.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoBlonde
Reviews.Content: Super facility, gorgeous views of the harbor and downtown, rooms were very nice, gourmet dining, and a spa. I was very impressed and would recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Average Property - Saved by the Location”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMorrison
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here maybe 10 times over the last 10 years, most recently during Comic-Con 2011. This is a decent place but it's had a lot of wear, and over the years it's gone downhill somewhat. The rooms are not quite as nice looking, little things like drips in the bathroom, old rugs, etc. What saves this place - and what keeps me coming back - is the wonderful location. About 2 blocks from a trolley stop and a few more blocks to downtown San Diego. If you take the train to San Diego (which I love), Amtrak is 5-10 minutes away (1 trolley stop). If your travels involve only downtown San Diego, the Convention Center area, or the harbor, then you really don't need a car at all. Perfect for Comic-Con!! The downside: train tracks run behind the hotel, so if you're a light sleeper I would look elsewhere. The pool scene is OK, but nothing special. The WiFi is free but spotty (although the Comic-Con crowd probably didn't help bandwidth). And the complimentary breakfast sure isn't much to brag about, but hey it's free! If you want more, Denny's is a block away. Also lots of REALLY GOOD restaurants a few blocks away in Little Italy. All in all, I still recommend this place, although it's in need of a freshening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for cruisers”
Reviews.Author: Cruiseah0lic
Reviews.Content: The Inn is very covenient & they provided transpotation from the airport to motel & the next morning took us to the cruise port. they provided a very nice breakfast in the morning. My wife & I found the rooms to be clean & comfortabe. At breakfast we met some peopl who were going on the same cruise. The location of the hotel was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever again”
Reviews.Author: kasey_johnson
Reviews.Content: It was awful. The elevator was disgusting, the rooms had this bizarre, sticky substance on all the surfaces and the "breakfast" was a joke. Oh no, it doesn't end there. Things were stolen out of our refrigerator, they claimed to have wireless but we couldn't ever access it and we were told there was a complimentary shuttle - but that was entirely misleading. We had three people staying in the room - one had a different flight then the other two and we were told we were only permitted ONE trip from and ONE trip to the airport. Total crap.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: scfulghum
Reviews.Content: Terrific location right next to trolley and Little Italy restaurants. Even downtown was walking distance. 2 blocks from water and multi ships & tours to see. Staff great: got directions to zoo, printed maps and on-line offers, answered questions, held onto bags & let me check in early. All in all - just perfect and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: ela8171
Reviews.Content: I liked the fact that Balboa Park was rather close to hotel. Vince at the front desk was very helpful with providing directions and information to different sites and places nearby. Don't forget to check out Anthony's Fish Grotto. The food and the views of the bay were terrific. Housekeeping always did a great job providing a clean and well kept room. Lots of traffic near the hotel, but overall a very pleasant stay. I'll be visiting again, hopefully with more time to explore this nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Hamburgerler
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers great value, service and location. Was able to check in 2 hours early and got an upgraded room. The shuttle service is great from the airport in 5 minutes. You can easly stay here and do most of the attractions without a car rental. Can easily walk (if you are not lazy) to Little Italy, Balboa Park, Harbor, and Gaslamp. Otherwise, the trolly stop is only 2blks away. Rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable, bed was firm but comfortable, good water pressure in shower. The train noise should only be an issue if you are sitting around in the room all day like a putz, they stop running at night so you can sleep. Breakfast not so good, but with a fridge/micro in room and convienence store around the corner, you can stock your own.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel for all cruise patrons in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: FrankHunter
Reviews.Content: Arriving a day early for a Carnival cruise, the hotel picked up our limo tab from the airport. Our one-night stay was delightful and the next day, they once again paid our tab to the ship even tho it was just a few blocks to walk. Upon our return to San Diego, the cab ride was paid by the hotel and...they safe-guarded our luggage until check-in time. The clerk told us to walk a two or three blocks and we could take the trolley over to OLD TOWN to spend the afternoon. What a treat. After staying that night, the hotel paid our cab fare to the airport. Service and convenience. If you are cruising from San Diego, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better But I'm Not Complaining”
Reviews.Author: ianwyj
Reviews.Content: Was in San Diego in mid-January for a conference and chose this establishment in order to keep costs down. Stayed for 5 nights in a double room and found the place pretty much as described by other visitors. Likes: Complimentary shuttle bus transfer to and from airport; friendly reception staff; clean, relatively large rooms with spacious rack space for clothes; located close to Little Italy restaurants and about 5 minutes walk from tram stop, as well as to pier attractions; and reasonable price. Not so good: Fairly basic breakfast; close to airport and train lines, I wasn't too bothered but noise from planes and trains (in early morning or late night) could be a problem for some travellers; tram service quite slow after 9 pm, helps to check carefully what the schedule is like after dark when returning to hotel; wifi was down/erratic for 2 nights. What you get is what you pay for. Overall, could have been better but certainly an economical option for the budget-conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay near the cruise port.”
Reviews.Author: volunteer1980
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel two days before our cruise because they provide all the amenities we require. Shuttle to pick you up at the airport & take you to the cruise port for free. The typical continential breakfast consists of cereal, sweet rolls, toast, fruit, juice, milk & coffee. Since this hotel is located in Little Italy there were several restaurant to walk to w/o calling for a taxi. The room we stayed in was furnished nicely with new carpet, granite bathroom counter, free safe, microwave & frig. The bed was very comfortable w/lots of pillows. We were near the airport but didn't notice any noice. We were greeted pleasantly by the receptionist. He helped in recommending local restaurants choices and was very helpful. We used the safe to put our computer and other valuables but on the second day we forgot to close it and when we return to the room we realized we forgot to lock the safe but in checking all the conents were there. I definitely would stay here again, the staff was very helpful and professional. This hotel meet all of our needs and at a very reasonable price. If you are looking for a clean, reasonable priced room located in a good location and providing all the amenities many other hotels would charge extra for than this is the place for you. I understand why this hotel is rated 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: mazellan40
Reviews.Content: on arrival at the hotel check in was smooth with the free courtesy bus dropping us at the hotel door. the room we were allocated was small and basic no room to put empty suitcases and you had to move a chair every time you wanted into the fridge. the first night the lavatory was blocked and we were given another room but had to go back to the original room the following morning. If you are a light sleeper I would recommend ear plugs as the train hoots several time an hour day and night as it passes behind the hotels back wall the trolley also run behind the hotel keeping you awake as do the planes that pass over head. breakfast was a bit of a bun fight as not a lot of room in reception if there were more than 4 people trying to get their breakfast all ant the same time. on the plus side it was an easy walk to the trolley stop or down town. b

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mlonetto
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, close to little Italy, the embarcadero, the trolley and downtown. Only one mile from the airport so you can hear planes and the train passes just behind the hotel but it's okay. There is a little pool and breakfast is really basic. For a few days with friends to discover the town, it's perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Salvoh
Reviews.Content: I travelled with 7 friends and we were all very happy with this hotel. Upon arrival, the staff informed us that they upgraded one of our rooms so that our two rooms could be next to each other. Each staff member was also very polite and helpful in giving advice on where to go and where to eat. The rooms were basic but had everything we needed, and the TVs were very nice. The location was good, away from downtown but safe and with a pleasant view of the harbour. It is easy to walk or catch the trolley downtown, although I wouldn't recommend the walk at night (taxis are only about $5). The free breakfast was more than adequate, and there are plenty of places to eat nearby. There aren't many parking spaces but we never missed out. Apparently it can get noisy with the trains in the middle of the night, but I, admittedly a heavy sleeper, never heard them. Overall we had a great time and the hotel was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice”
Reviews.Author: RMC2
Reviews.Content: This property surprised me. Check in was easy, friendly staff on every shift, daylight continental breakfast was adequate, fresh and well stocked. They are in the process of rennovating the hotel, our rooms had been nicely redone. Rooms were quiet for sleeping and room was well equipped (micro, coffee, towels, soaps and shampoos). Nice flat screen tv mounted on wall (part of rennovation). Pool was clean. Free shuttle service to and from airport - best part of trip! Only a short walk to harbor and activities. Restaurants within walking distance. Hotel staff offered great restaurant recommendations. Very nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: travelinlife4me
Reviews.Content: Well located near Harbor attractions. Fairly easy walk to downtown, Gaslamp and Petco Park....or you can walk a few block and catch the Trolley near Little Italy. Very safe area to walk. Room was good, with small, clean, recently renovated bathroom. Convienent to have fridge and microwave in the room. Unlike most hotels fridge's, this one actually got cold. Chairs in the room were stained and the AC wasn't the greatest are the negatives. Could see workman renovating other rooms. Spartan breakfat with just the basics. Friendly staff let me leave my car on the lot the afternoon after checkout, until I returned from Padres game. Couple blocks down the street try Las Panchitos Mexican Restauarnt. No frills place for eat-in or carry-out. They serve beer and excellent fish tacos.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: RoamingAimlessly
Reviews.Content: The Days Inn was a reasonable place to stay -- had 3 floors with an outside elevator (a drawback), you could see that the motel was old. Nice looking outdoor pool. Ice and soda machine located at the back of the elevator, in the parking lot. There had been updates done to the building. Our room was comfortable and clean. We stayed here because it was close to the cruise dock, our ship was arriving for our cruise to begin our cruise the next day. The Days Inn had a complimentary shuttle to the cruise ship terminal which made things very easy. Complimentary breakfast -- normal breads, cereal, etc. No fuss, no muss, reasonable priced and centrally located. Many restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and getting better”
Reviews.Author: MN_Cruisers
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here five times in the last 18 months and have enjoyed every visit. The front desk staff are the friendliest and most helpful that we have encountered at any hotel. We will continue to stay here when we visit San Diego. They are undergoing renovation of the property and we stayed in renovated rooms this visit. The beds and pillows are very comfortable and nice. The towels could use a bit of upgrading though. The breakfast is very basic but there is nothing wrong with cereal and milk. There is some noise from the train tracks behind the hotel but not too bothersome. The satellite TV feed does not come in very good for a few channels.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: bigeasy43
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and found it to be a very comfortable well located hotel. The breakfast in the morning left a little to be desired but other than that the service was great and the room was very nice. Not to be mistaken for the Hyatt or Crowne Plaza downtown but also about a 1/3 of the rate. Also the free shuttle to and from the airport was a very nice touch. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting reasonable accommodations on the bay in San Diego close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out ok”
Reviews.Author: our56
Reviews.Content: A last minute decision to visit San Diego after being bumped off flights home to Australia after staying 3 days in L.A. Caught the Greyhound bus from downtown L.A. and arrived at the bus terminal in early afternoon with no hotel booked. Rang Expedia.com as we could book online due visa card not US issue. Only available hotel close to to everything and at a good price (US$120) over weekend was Days Inn Harborview. We booked and caught a cab, no question it was close to everything from trolley tram stop to Little Italy for dinning and the harbor for some sightseeing. On arrival things looked ok till we went to our room. This manager said the room was one of their new rooms, it wasn't new it just had a new tv and appliances, therew as no mention that renovations were going on and the car-park outside room was the storage & workprep area. Well we thought that it would be okay as we planned to be out all day anyway. Just after putting our bags down in the room, my 12yo son(smaller than average size) used the toilet and it blocked up. Could not unblock it and went to reception to inform them. They said that it couldn't be fixed till the morning. I asked the managers wife who had now taken over that we had just traveled from L.A. and were not happy how things were turning out I was ready to leave. She gave me a key to another room this time on the 3rd(top floor) she said it had just been refurbished and to her credit it was brand new, never used since new paint & carpets, new bathroom, the shower curtain hadn't been put up yet. that's how I know we were first to use. They had the shower curtain up within the hour. The room turned out to be better than average, the smell of paint was very faint and a couple of hours with the door open fixed that problem. Everything worked great from the fridge to the hairdryer. Problem with the brand new in room safe, it was installed in a spot that didn't allow the door to open more than 5 inches. This would of been ok for us as we only needed to travel documents in except the opening was against the side wall so in reality you couldn't put anything in it. Complimentary b/f was good, not much variety but plenty of what there was. It all worked out ok in the end and if all of the refurbished rooms when complete are anything like ours then you will find it worth the money. As far as the noise from trains go I didn't notice but I live near an international airport so I used to noise.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Wanda53
Reviews.Content: We had to stay in San Diego for 3 days, and chose the Days Inn. The room was spacious enough for two adults, and came with 2 queen size beds, a microwave, coffee maker, plasma TV, alarm clock, and small fridge. The fridge did not work, but management came up within 10 minutes to replace it. The sink is in an alcove outside of the bathroom. The linens and towels were clean, and plentiful. The 4 pillows on each bed were VERY soft and comfortable. The room okay, but a bit dark. Our room was quite musty until we got the air conditioner going. The exterior walkways seem a bit rundown. We were on the third floor, and some of the nearby rooms are undergoing renovation, so there is dust and workmen near the elevator. Did not eat the complimentary breakfast, but there is a Dennys a block away. For light sleepers, the Amtrak sounds do come through the windows. The motel is very convenient to public transportation (trolleys, buses), the harbor, and the airport (10 minutes away via shuttle).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: brpl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Days Inn Harbor View for a family reunion. This location was perfect for each activity we planned: cruise, Old Town Trolly, shopping, dining, etc. The complimentary transportation to/from airport and cruise terminal simplified our visit. Departure day meant multiple pickups by Cloud9 as each group had different flight times. Arthur (at the front desk) accommodated our every need which helped to enhance the experience. He was friendly, welcoming us with a big smile each time we went to the office or called him on the phone. Arthur very graciously assisted us with online confirmations for return home flights and even provided his own hand tools to open a damaged lock on a suitcase. Definately not Hapuna Prince in Hawaii, it is after all a Days Inn facility, so did not expect extra plushy towels and 5-star rooms. Days Inn Harbor View gets thumbs up from us! Will gladly stay here again. Yes parking is tight and turn around space limited, but location sure beats other, more expensive lodging options in the area. Actually pre-booked online and saved an average $30 per night per room by doing so. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located to Attractions”
Reviews.Author: mcstix
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on my way back from Las Vegas. Arrived about 8:00 at night and had no trouble checking in. One problem was that the guy said it would be fine for me to let him know the next day whether I'd be staying another night or not, but when I went down the next morning to tell them I wanted to stay another night they initially told me I could not because they were now "full." Actually worked out well though as manager "fixed it" so that I could stay...since they had told me it would be no problem the night before. I ended up staying four nights at about $100 each night (apparently a bargain.) Be aware (or beware!) of the TRAIN that runs DIRECTLY behind the hotel several times each day...and early in the morning. If you are a light sleeper this may bother you. I am a light sleeper but used earplugs and was fine. There is a Denny's just up the street north from the hotel, which was convenient. There is also a Jack-in-the-box fast food restaurant just a block or so south of the hotel. "Little Italy" is close by, and so is the "Gaslamp Quarter" as is Seaport Village...a nice marina area to walk around in, though I'd say none are really a short walk, and all are in opposite directions from the hotel, which is kind of in the middle of them. Overall however, this hotel/motel is in a prime spot, and cheaper than many others nearby such as the Holiday Inn, Hampton Inn, Embassy Suites etc. Also PARKING IS FREE, which is nearly unHEARD of in downtown San Diego! I believe the Internet was also free, but I did have some problems getting it to work all the time. My room was pretty far from the front desk. Perhaps this was part of the problem as it was a wireless only service. I would not recommend this place if you'll be surfing online a lot due to the Internet problems.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Bleeker151
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Days Inn hotel that you will see all over the world. The trolley stop is very close at the back of the hotel which will take you to the downtown area or you could walk as it's only a 10 minute walk. One downside to the place was the noise of the trains passing the hotel from six in the morning, they are quitr loud.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: northerngirl26
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here the night before we were to leave on a cruise. The shuttles to/from airport and to/from the cruise ship terminal was what really attracted us to this hotel. There was some shuttle issues at the airport, but that has nothing to do with the hotel (the have a contract with a local shuttle company). I had called the hotel a few different times with questions and the people at the front desk were always very helpful. It was no different when we needed a dinner recommendation. We had one of only two harbor view rooms, I felt it was worth the few extra dollars to have the view. The room was nice and clean. The only major turn off was the breakfast. The orange juice pitcher was empty within the first 5 minutes, the bagles and bread was cleaned out soon after. The front desk staff was more than happy to stock, but only after you asked. That is an area I feel they could improve upon. As other reviewers have mentioned, the last thing you hear when you fall asleep is the train going by and the first thing in the morning is the train. I've spent most of my life on trains, so it really did not bother me at all. Overall though, this was a good hotel/

Reviews.Title: “Yes you get what you pay for...but we still liked it!”
Reviews.Author: SeaKing65
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend stay at this hotel and have the following comments: ***This was a last minute booking (Booked Monday evening for Friday arrival). I usually stay at another hotel chain, but couldn't get in at the last minute so I ended up here. The thing that clinched the deal was the rate and comp train shuttle.*** Front desk staff - AWESOME! They comped the shuttle from the train station to the hotel and allowed me to pay for the room and leave bags in room while going out for breakfast on departure day. AND THEY ENFORCE THE NO PARTY RULE! They didn't hesitate to have SDPD remove loud party people from the room next door. Location - easy walk to just about anything. No need to rent car or worry about parking. Trains and Trolley - go behind the hotel, but unless you are a super light sleeper its not a real problem. Pool - just a pool and no jacuzzi but the kids loved it! Room - stayed on the 3rd floor in one of the nicer rooms. The sofa bed was actually quite comfy and the king bed had a good mattress. Got a great AAA rate of about $29 off the standard rate. Tub was small but the shower had good water pressure. Breakfast - just enough to get you on your way. If you need something more filling, Denny's isn't even a block away. Kid friendly - Yes. And the kids were better behaved than the adults. Likely to go back - If I can't stay at another hotel I like, this is a great last minute booking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it...”
Reviews.Author: SillyPutty78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on July 4th primarily because it was in an area of the city I was familiar with and because by the time we booked, no beach area hotels were available (Friday night, July 4th...). Oh yeah, and the price was good. :) I thought it looked kind of dumpy on the outside- we were on the third floor. When we opened the door we were actually really pleasantly surprised. The room was nice, clean, and spacious. Nice flatscreen TVs, kind of a cool tile table... The towels were a bit scratchy and we didn't have a lot of luck with their wifi (we connected to a nearby hotel that had a better signal...), didn't use the pool but there were people in it, and there was train noise. Parking wasn't a problem (and it was a holiday with lots of cars parked in the lot across the street for the fireworks). The staff was friendly. The breakfast was a bare minimum kind of thing like others have described. Overall, it was inexpensive, easy to get to, and comfortable enough. I probably wouldn't stay for a week, but for an overnight I was very satisfied. Not fancy, but certainly decent for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Please read before you book...”
Reviews.Author: momilomilomi
Reviews.Content: I booked directly through Days Inn on-line. Days Inn gave this hotel/ motel a "5 Sunburst" rating, giving it their quality assurance. I'd hate to see anything less! Cons: Train runs behind the hotel--it's horn can be heard whenever it passes--including night and early morning. Rooms are not sound proof. Towel bar fell off the wall. Water temperature changes while taking a shower. Beds were very firm. Although parking is free, it is limited if you return late. Floors are dirty. Not sure if they vacuum--feet turned black, walking bare-foot on the carpet. Towels were very thin, stained and small. Not enough towels were provided for number of guests registered. Pros: Microwave and refrigerator. Free parking. Free breakfast--bread (toast), pastry, coffee. Bottom line: Not what I expected. Pictures are deceiving--the hotel is more run down than pictured. If your a sound-sleeper and need a hard bed then this is the place for you, if not save yourself the aggravation and book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some work for the price.”
Reviews.Author: pattidawn
Reviews.Content: The rooms are standard but clean. However, we found that the towels were stained badly. We were given unstained towels after we asked for them. The people were great, very friendly and helpful but had to always ask for things that should have just been...like the towels. The "continental breakfast" was dry toast and stale danish. I left my favorite raggedy pajamas and have called four times to have them sent back to me. Even gave them my credit card to ship. Still waiting. Walking distance to water and town. Decent low budget place....but really not so low budget price.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for downtown, but kind of icky”
Reviews.Author: MrPizz
Reviews.Content: There were no major problems with this hotel, and it was the cheapest one downtown. The location is good (about a mile walk to most of the bars/restaurants downtown and right on the harbor). The room itself (and the beds) looked and felt like they hadn't been updated in about 20 years, and the whole place has kind of a worn-down feel to it. Then again, its probably still worth it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased with Days Inn Harbor View in S.D.!”
Reviews.Author: grammytokim
Reviews.Content: We chose this motel because of cost and location to the ship terminals - we were very pleased. Sure, it's not the "Ritz"; but then again we weren't paying high prices! The guys working behind the desk were totally awesome - very helpful and friendlyl! Even helped get online with the computer available in the office, gave suggestions on pizza delivery - even where to walk to get camera supplies. The shuttle service provided to the ship terminal and airport - free! - was very reliable. The continental breakfast was simple - but again, the cost of the room was so reasonable - they couldn't provide a buffet! The view looking out on the water was great - awesome sunsets! Also close to the train pickup - so you could ride the train to Old Town, Tijuana, Horton's Plaza - all day for one low price. (Yes, the train runs behind the motel, but not once did it bother us. We slept well! (Stayed there for 2 nights.) For the price of the room - it was clean with friendly staff - what more could you ask for!?! Would stay there again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: NewHavenTraveller
Reviews.Content: Good rate for a place to sleep near the airport, but noisy area. Our supposedly non-smoking room smelled horribly of smoke and the a/c made it worse. The beds were too hard for our comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Problem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Diego Days Inn Harbor View, luckily, for just one night. We arrived and settled into our room, which was worn, but at that time that was ok for me for a queen room for $59 (before tax). Shortly after arriving I noticed a cockroach. I killed it, and not being overly squeamish about roaches, I figured that it was ok, there was just one and we were after all on the ground floor. But then a few minutes later I saw another, bigger one. That's when I notified the front desk to get our room changed. They did so, to a "nicer" room, meaning that it was bigger. The room was still worn, however, and the tub didn't work properly. We had to wedge one of their bars of soap in the drain to keep it open so that the water would drain while we showered the next morning. Anyway, I didn't notice any more bugs and we went to sleep, although I was never truly comfortable all night and kept worrying about waking up with roaches crawling on me. The room (another on the ground floor) was noisy with cars pulling in at night, some with loud radios. We also had someone loudly knock on our door at 5:30 am (it was the wrong room), but I guess that wasn't the hotel's fault. The next morning we got up and found two baby roaches in the bathroom. Luckily, we were checking out. I told the guy at the front desk and he said that they try to keep them out but all of San Diego has a roach problem. Hmmm. The hotel does have a free airport shuttle service, which was good. The airport is literally a five minute drive away. Overall, we would definitely not stay there again. Even though it was cheap, it was not worth it.

HotelInfo.Name: San Diego - Days Inn Harbor View / Airport / Convention Ctr
HotelInfo.Address: 1919 Pacific Highway, San Diego, CA 92101
